rows.Name: bone_visibility
rows.Description: A JSON object that contains a list of key/value pairs that map from bone name in the specified geometry file (key) to a boolean that tells whether the bone should be visible or not (value).

rows.Name: minecraft:breathability
rows.Description: Determines whether the block is breathable by defining if the block is treated as a `solid` or as `air`. The default is `solid` if this component is omitted.

rows.Name: minecraft:collision_box
Description: Defines the area of the block that collides with entities. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, the block's collision with entities is disabled. If this component is omitted, default values are used.

rows.Name: origin
rows.Description: Minimal position of the bounds of the collision box. "origin" is specified as [x, y, z] and must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.

rows.Name: size
rows.Description: Size of each side of the collision box. Size is specified as [x, y, z]. "origin" + "size" must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.

rows.Name: minecraft:crafting_table
Description: Makes your block into a custom crafting table which enables the crafting table UI and the ability to craft recipes. This component supports only "recipe_shaped" and "recipe_shapeless" typed recipes and not others like "recipe_furnace" or "recipe_brewing_mix". If there are two recipes for one item, the recipe book will pick the first that was parsed. If two input recipes are the same, crafting may assert and the resulting item may vary.

content: Defines the tags recipes should define to be crafted on this table. Limited to 64 tags. Each tag is limited to 64 characters.

Specifies the language file key that maps to what text will be displayed in the UI of this table. If the string given can not be resolved as a loc string, the raw string given will be displayed. If this field is omitted, the name displayed will default to the name specified in the "display_name" component. If this block has no "display_name" component, the name displayed will default to the name of the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:custom_components
rows.Description: Sets an ordered list of custom component names which are bound in script to be executed upon a block event.

rows.Name: minecraft:destructible_by_explosion
Description: Describes the destructible by explosion properties for this block. If set to true, the block will have the default explosion resistance. If set to false, this block is indestructible by explosion. If the component is omitted, the block will have the default explosion resistance.

rows.Name: explosion_resistance
rows.Description: Sets the explosion resistance for the block. Greater values result in greater resistance to explosions. The scale will be different for different explosion power levels. A negative value or 0 means it will easily explode; larger numbers increase level of resistance.

rows.Name: minecraft:destructible_by_mining
Description: Describes the destructible by mining properties for this block. If set to true, the block will take the default number of seconds to destroy. If set to false, this block is indestructible by mining. If the component is omitted, the block will take the default number of seconds to destroy.

rows.Name: item_specific_speeds
Description: Optional array of objects to describe item specific block destroy speeds, each object contains an 'item' ItemDescriptor and a 'destroy_speed' float. This array currently requires UpcomingFeatures experiment to be enabled.

content: A destroy speed applied while using the defined 'item'.
An ItemDescriptor filtering for the item used while mining.

rows.Name: seconds_to_destroy
rows.Description: Sets the number of seconds it takes to destroy the block with base equipment. Greater numbers result in greater mining times.

rows.Name: minecraft:display_name
rows.Description: Specifies the language file key that maps to what text will be displayed when you hover over the block in your inventory and hotbar. If the string given can not be resolved as a loc string, the raw string given will be displayed. If this component is omitted, the name of the block will be used as the display name.

rows.Name: minecraft:flammable
Description: Describes the flammable properties for this block. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, or if this component is omitted, the block will not be able to catch on fire naturally from neighbors, but it can still be directly ignited.

rows.Name: catch_chance_modifier
rows.Description: A modifier affecting the chance that this block will catch flame when next to a fire. Values are greater than or equal to 0, with a higher number meaning more likely to catch on fire. For a "catch_chance_modifier" greater than 0, the fire will continue to burn until the block is destroyed (or it will burn forever if the "destroy_chance_modifier" is 0). If the "catch_chance_modifier" is 0, and the block is directly ignited, the fire will eventually burn out without destroying the block (or it will have a chance to be destroyed if "destroy_chance_modifier" is greater than 0). The default value of 5 is the same as that of Planks.

rows.Name: destroy_chance_modifier
rows.Description: A modifier affecting the chance that this block will be destroyed by flames when on fire. Values are greater than or equal to 0, with a higher number meaning more likely to be destroyed by fire. For a "destroy_chance_modifier" of 0, the block will never be destroyed by fire, and the fire will burn forever if the "catch_chance_modifier" is greater than 0. The default value of 20 is the same as that of Planks.

rows.Name: minecraft:friction
rows.Description: Describes the friction for this block in a range of (0.0-0.9). Friction affects an entity's movement speed when it travels on the block. Greater value results in more friction.

rows.Name: minecraft:geometry
rows.Description: The description identifier of the geometry to use to render this block. This identifier must either match an existing geometry identifier in any of the loaded resource packs or be one of the currently supported Vanilla identifiers: "minecraft:geometry.full_block" or "minecraft:geometry.cross".

rows.Name: minecraft:light_dampening
rows.Description: The amount that light will be dampened when it passes through the block, in a range (0-15). Higher value means the light will be dampened more.

rows.Name: minecraft:light_emission
rows.Description: The amount of light this block will emit in a range (0-15). Higher value means more light will be emitted.

rows.Name: minecraft:loot
rows.Description: The path to the loot table, relative to the behavior pack. Path string is limited to 256 characters.

rows.Name: minecraft:map_color
rows.Description: Sets the color of the block when rendered to a map. The color is represented as a hex value in the format "#RRGGBB". May also be expressed as an array of [R, G, B] from 0 to 255. If this component is omitted, the block will not show up on the map.

rows.Name: minecraft:material_instances
Description: The material instances for a block. Maps face or material_instance names in a geometry file to an actual material instance. You can assign a material instance object to any of these faces: "up", "down", "north", "south", "east", "west", or "*". You can also give an instance the name of your choosing such as "my_instance", and then assign it to a face by doing "north":"my_instance".

content: A material instance definition to map to a material instance in a geometry file. The material instance "*" will be used for any materials that don't have a match.

rows.Name: ambient_occlusion
rows.Description: Should this material have ambient occlusion applied when lighting? If true, shadows will be created around and underneath the block.

rows.Name: face_dimming
rows.Description: Should this material be dimmed by the direction it's facing?

rows.Name: render_method
rows.Description: The render method to use. Must be one of these options:"opaque" - Used for a regular block texture without an alpha layer. Does not allow for transparency or translucency."double_sided" - Used for completely disabling backface culling."blend" - Used for a block like stained glass. Allows for transparency and translucency (slightly transparent textures)."alpha_test" - Used for a block like the vanilla (unstained) glass. Does not allow for translucency, only fully opaque or fully transparent textures. Also disables backface culling.

rows.Name: texture
rows.Description: Texture name for the material.

rows.Name: minecraft:placement_filter
Description: Sets rules for under what conditions the block can be placed/survive

content: List of conditions where the block can be placed/survive. Limited to 64 conditions.

rows.Name: allowed_faces
rows.Description: List of any of the following strings describing which face(s) this block can be placed on: "up", "down", "north", "south", "east", "west", "side", "all". Limited to 6 faces.

rows.Name: block_filter
Description: List of blocks that this block can be placed against in the "allowed_faces" direction. Limited to 64 blocks. Each block in this list can either be specified as a String (block name) or as a BlockDescriptor. A BlockDescriptor is an object that allows you to reference a block (or multiple blocks) based on its tags, or based on its name and states. The fields of a BlockDescriptor are described below.

rows.Name: name
rows.Description: The name of a block.

rows.Name: states
rows.Description: The list of Vanilla block states and their values that the block can have, expressed in key/value pairs.

rows.Name: tags
rows.Description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false that can be used to query for blocks with certain tags.

rows.Name: minecraft:queued_ticking
Description: Triggers the specified event, either once, or at a regular interval equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range provided.

rows.Name: interval_range
rows.Description: A range of values, specified in ticks, that will be used to decide the interval between times this event triggers. Each interval will be chosen randomly from the range, so the times between this event triggering will differ given an interval_range of two different values. If the values in the interval_range are the same, the event will always be triggered after that number of ticks.

rows.Name: looping
rows.Description: Does the event loop? If false, the event will only be triggered once, after a delay equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range. If true, the event will loop, and each interval between events will be equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range.

rows.Name: on_tick
Description: The event that will be triggered once or on an interval.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false. If true on the scheduled tick, the event will be triggered. If false on the scheduled tick, the event will not be triggered.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event that will be triggered.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of the event executed by the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:random_ticking
Description: Triggers the specified event randomly based on the random tick speed gamerule. The random tick speed determines how often blocks are updated. Some other examples of game mechanics that use random ticking are crop growth and fire spreading.

rows.Name: on_tick
Description: The event that will be triggered on random ticks.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false. If true on the random tick, the event will be triggered. If false on the random tick, the event will not be triggered.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event that will be triggered.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of the event executed by the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:redstone_conductivity
Description: The basic redstone properties of a block; if the component is not provided the default values are used. Requires 1.21.30 format version and above.
Experimental toggles required: Upcoming Creator Features (in format versions before 1.21.30)

rows.Name: allows_wire_to_step_down
rows.Description: Specifies if redstone wire can stair-step downward on the block.

rows.Name: redstone_conductor
rows.Description: Specifies if the block can be powered by redstone.

rows.Name: minecraft:selection_box
Description: Defines the area of the block that is selected by the player's cursor. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, this block is not selectable by the player's cursor. If this component is omitted, default values are used.

rows.Name: origin
rows.Description: Minimal position of the bounds of the selection box. "origin" is specified as [x, y, z] and must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.

rows.Name: size
rows.Description: Size of each side of the selection box. Size is specified as [x, y, z]. "origin" + "size" must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.

rows.Name: minecraft:transformation
Description: The block's translation, rotation and scale with respect to the center of its world position

content: The block's rotation in increments of 90 degrees
The point to apply rotation around
The point to apply scale around

rows.Name: minecraft:unit_cube
rows.Description: Specifies that a unit cube is to be used with tessellation.

sections.name: Block Definition Properties
content: These properties are part of the Block Definition. This helps the system determine how to parse and initialize this block.

rows.Name: format_version
rows.Description: Specifies the version of the game this entity was made in. If the version is lower than the current version, any changes made to the entity in the vanilla version will be applied to it.

rows.Name: identifier
rows.Description: The identifier for this block. The name must include a namespace and must not use the Minecraft namespace unless overriding a Vanilla block.

sections.name: Block Event Responses
content: Event responses for block trigger components.

rows.Name: add_mob_effect
Description: Apply mob effect to target.

rows.Name: amplifier
rows.Description: The amplifier for the mob effect.

rows.Name: duration
rows.Description: The duration of the mob effect.

rows.Name: effect
rows.Description: The mob effect to apply.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: damage
Description: Deals damage to the target.

rows.Name: amount
rows.Description: The amount of damage to deal.

rows.Name: mob_amount
rows.Description: The amount of damage to deal if held by a mob.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: type
rows.Description: The type of damage to deal.

rows.Name: decrement_stack
rows.Description: Decrement item stack.

rows.Name: die
Description: Kill target. If target is self and this is run from a block then destroy the block.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: play_effect
Description: Spawns a particle effect relative to target position.

rows.Name: data
rows.Description: Particle data value.

rows.Name: effect
rows.Description: The name of the particle effect to create.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: play_sound
Description: Play a sound relative to target position.

rows.Name: sound
rows.Description: The name of the sound to play.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: remove_mob_effect
Description: Removes mob effect from target.

rows.Name: effect
rows.Description: The mob effect to remove. Use 'all' to remove all mob effects from target.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: run_command
Description: Triggers a slash command or a list of slash commands.

rows.Name: command
rows.Description: Slash command to run.

rows.Name: command array
rows.Description: List of slash commands to run.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: set_block
Description: Sets this block to another block type.

rows.Name: block_type
rows.Description: The type of block to set.

rows.Name: set_block_at_pos
Description: Sets a block relative to this block to another block type.

rows.Name: block_offset
rows.Description: The offset from the block's center.

rows.Name: block_type
rows.Description: The type of block to set.

rows.Name: set_block_state
Description: Sets a block state on this block.

rows.Name: state
rows.Description: Block state to set on the block.

rows.Name: spawn_loot
Description: Spawn loot from block.

rows.Name: table
rows.Description: File path, relative to the Behavior Pack's path, to the loot table file.

rows.Name: swing
rows.Description: Event causes the actor to swing.

rows.Name: teleport
Description: Teleport target randomly around destination point.

rows.Name: avoid_water
rows.Description: Determines if the teleport avoids putting the target in water.

rows.Name: destination
rows.Description: Origin destination of the teleport.

rows.Name: land_on_block
rows.Description: Determines if the teleport places the target on a block.

rows.Name: max_range
rows.Description: Max range the target can teleport relative to the origin destination.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target context to execute against.

rows.Name: transform_item
Description: Transforms item into another item.

rows.Name: transform
rows.Description: Name of the item it should transform into

rows.Name: minecraft:on_fall_on
Description: Describes event for this block.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event executed on the block.

rows.Name: min_fall_distance
rows.Description: The minimum distance in blocks that an actor needs to fall to trigger this event.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of event executed on the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:on_interact
Description: Describes event for this block.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event executed on the block.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of event executed on the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:on_placed
Description: Describes event for this block.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event executed on the block.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of event executed on the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:on_player_destroyed
Description: Describes event for this block.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event executed on the block.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of event executed on the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:on_player_placing
Description: Describes event for this block.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event executed on the block.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of event executed on the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:on_step_off
Description: Describes event for this block.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event executed on the block.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of event executed on the block.

rows.Name: minecraft:on_step_on
Description: Describes event for this block.

rows.Name: condition
rows.Description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.

rows.Name: event
rows.Description: The event executed on the block.

rows.Name: target
rows.Description: The target of event executed on the block.
